query.description: Specifies the type of authorization request being made. For an authorization code grant this value must be `code`.
query.name: responseType

query.description: A string identifying the client application making this request. Labeled in [API Access](/access) for an individual application as "Client ID".
query.name: clientId

query.description: The callback URL registered for an application. This value must match one of the URLs specified for the application in [API Access](/access) or the request will return an error.
query.name: redirectUri

query.description: A space-delimited, case-sensitive list of scopes to which to request access. The user may not grant access to any or all requested scopes. See [Using OAuth](/documentation/guides/using-oauth) for a list of valid scopes.
query.name: scope

query.description: An opaque value supplied by the client to maintain state between the request and callback. The authorization server includes this value when redirecting the user-agent back to the client. The parameter **should** be used for preventing cross-site request forgery.
query.name: state

query.description: Identifies the type of authorization request being made. For a client credentials grant this value *must* be `authorization_code`.
query.name: grantType

query.description: The authorization code received from the authorization server.
query.name: code

query.description: Must be identical to the `redirect_uri` value used in the authorization request.
query.name: redirectUri

query.description: A string identifying the client application making this request. Labeled in [API Access](/access) for an individual application as "Client ID".
query.name: clientId

header.description: The user's bearer token. The OAuth 2.0 spec requires the Authorization header be formatted as "Bearer {token}", where {token} is the alpha-numeric authorization token returned by a previous OAuth grant flow.
header.name: authorization

query.description: The user's bearer token.
query.name: accessToken

query.description: Identifies the type of authorization request being made. For a client credentials grant this value *must* be `client_credentials`.
query.name: grantType

query.description: A space-delimited, case-sensitive list of scopes that to which to request access. The user may not grant access to any or all requested scopes. See [Using OAuth](/documentation/guides/using-oauth) for a list of valid scopes.
query.name: scope

query.description: The user's bearer token.
query.name: token

query.description: The user's bearer token.
query.name: token

query.description: The slug of the set the card belongs to. If you do not supply a value, cards from all sets will be returned.
query.name: set

query.description: The slug of the card's class.
query.name: class

query.description: The mana cost required to play the card. You can include multiple values in a comma-separated list of numeric values.
query.name: manaCost

query.description: The attack power of the minion or weapon. You can include multiple values in a comma-separated list of numeric values.
query.name: attack

query.description: The health of a minion. You can include multiple values in a comma-separated list of numeric values.
query.name: health

query.description: Whether a card is collectible. A value of 1 indicates that collectible cards should be returned; 0 indicates uncollectible cards. To return all cards, use a value of '0,1'.
query.name: collectible

query.description: The rarity of a card. This value must match the rarity slugs found in metadata.
query.name: rarity

query.description: The type of card (for example, minion, spell, and so on). This value must match the type slugs found in metadata.
query.name: type

query.description: The type of minion card (for example, beast, murloc, dragon, and so on). This value must match the minion type slugs found in metadata.
query.name: minionType

query.description: A required keyword on the card (for example, battlecry, deathrattle, and so on). This value must match the keyword slugs found in metadata.
query.name: keyword

query.description: A text string used to filter cards. You must include a locale along with the textFilter parameter.
query.name: textFilter

query.description: A page number.
query.name: page

query.description: The number of results to choose per page. A value will be selected automatically if you do not supply a pageSize or if the pageSize is higher than the maximum allowed.
query.name: pageSize

query.description: The field used to sort the results. Valid values include manaCost, attack, health, and name. Results are sorted by manaCost by default. Cards will also be sorted by class automatically in most cases.
query.name: sort

query.description: The order in which to sort the results. Valid values are asc or desc. The default value is asc.
query.name: order

query.description: The slug of the set the card belongs to. If you do not supply a value, cards from all sets will be returned.
query.name: set

query.description: The slug of the card's class.
query.name: class

query.description: The mana cost required to play the card. You can include multiple values in a comma-separated list of numeric values.
query.name: manaCost

query.description: The attack power of the minion or weapon. You can include multiple values in a comma-separated list of numeric values.
query.name: attack

query.description: The health of a minion. You can include multiple values in a comma-separated list of numeric values.
query.name: health

query.description: Whether a card is collectible. A value of 1 indicates that collectible cards should be returned; 0 indicates uncollectible cards. To return all cards, use a value of '0,1'.
query.name: collectible

query.description: The rarity of a card. This value must match the rarity slugs found in metadata.
query.name: rarity

query.description: The type of card (for example, minion, spell, and so on). This value must match the type slugs found in metadata.
query.name: type

query.description: The type of minion card (for example, beast, murloc, dragon, and so on). This value must match the minion type slugs found in metadata.
query.name: minionType

query.description: A required keyword on the card (for example, battlecry, deathrattle, and so on). This value must match the keyword slugs found in metadata.
query.name: keyword

query.description: A text string used to filter cards. You must include a locale along with the textFilter parameter.
query.name: textFilter

query.description: A page number.
query.name: page

query.description: The number of results to choose per page. A value will be selected automatically if you do not supply a pageSize or if the pageSize is higher than the maximum allowed.
query.name: pageSize

query.description: The field used to sort the results. Valid values include manaCost, attack, health, and name. Results are sorted by manaCost by default. Cards will also be sorted by class automatically in most cases.
query.name: sort

query.description: The order in which to sort the results. Valid values are asc or desc. The default value is asc.
query.name: order
